page.topic: Dynamically Re-Populate Choices in a Dropdown Box
page.description: You can create a dropdown box that allows users to enter new options to the dropdown list. These entries can be made using a pop-up window and then stored in a SQL database.

section.description: For a visual explanation watch this three part video: [Part 1], [Part 2], [Part 3], or follow the step by step guide below.

section.title: Create a Dynamically Populated DropDown Box

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu. Click on the [DropdownBox] option to add a dropdown box to the component. Give the dropdown box the name and label 'product'.
In the properties list on the right scroll down to the 'DropDownBox' properties. Click the [...] button next to the 'Choices' property.
In the 'Define Choices' dialog select the 'Dynamic' radio button option in the 'Choices are' menu.
In the property settings that appear set the 'Data source type' to be 'AlphaDAO'.
Click the [...] button next to the 'AlphaDAO Connection string name' property.
Create a connection to the Northwind database. Click OK to return to the Define Choices dialog.
Click the [...] button next to the 'AlphaDAO SQL SELECT statement' property.
In the 'SQL Select' dialog's 'Genie' tab click the 'Select button next to the 'Table' textbox and select the 'Products' table.
Expand the 'Field to display' dropdown in the SQL Select dialog and select the 'ProductName' field. Click OK to close the dialog.
Back in the 'Define Choices' dialog click the [...] button next to the 'Additional choices (Pre)' property.
Add the following to the 'Specify Choices' definition and click OK and OK again to close the Define Choices dialog.
Back on the UX Controls page, scroll down the 'product' drop-down box control's properties list to the 'Javascript' section. Click the [...] button next to the 'onChange' property.
